qas.question: What was the name of the port once situated on the land occupied by present day Plymouth?
When did the Pilgrim Fathers depart Plymouth for the Americas?
What monument commemorates the departure of the Pilgrim Fathers?
How many marine species are present at the National Marine Aquarium?
How many listed buildings are present in the Barbican area?

context: The early port settlement of Plymouth, called "<a0_0>Sutton<a0_0/>", approximates to the area now referred to as the Barbican and has <a4_0>100<a4_0/> listed buildings and the largest concentration of cobbled streets in Britain. The Pilgrim Fathers left for the New World in <a1_0>1620<a1_0/> near the commemorative <a2_0>Mayflower Steps<a2_0/> in Sutton Pool. Also on Sutton Pool is the National Marine Aquarium which displays <a3_0>400<a3_0/> marine species and includes Britain's deepest aquarium tank.
